question: Which of the following terms denotes the funds set aside by the banks to cover loan losses?
explanation: PCR indicates extent of funds a bank has kept aside to cover loan losses. A higher provision coverage ratio leads to higher risk taking capacity of the bank. The desirable limit of PCR is 70% though not mandatory. Recently, we read in the newspapers that out of 21 public sector banks in India, only 6 have crossed the 'desirable' level of 70% Provision Coverage Ratio (PCR).
